alert.note: Alert for Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 5:50PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong Winds with Rain changing to Snow This Evening... Northwest winds will increase this evening in the wake of a cold frontal passage. Winds will become sustained near 30 mph and gust up to 45 mph at times. This will make for difficult travel for high profile vehicles, especially on north...south roadways. In addition, the northwest winds will usher in much colder air and this will cause the rain to change over to a period of sleet and snow as the evening progresses. Visibilities in the snow could be reduced to a mile or less due to the gusty winds. Accumulations look to be under an inch and mainly on grassy and elevated surfaces, but some slick spots could develop on bridges and overpasses as temperatures drop to near the freezing mark by mid to late evening. Be alert for these changing conditions if traveling this evening.
